snippet: A surge in anti-abortion measures in more than half the states has made it far more difficult in many regions to obtain the procedure.
abstract: Three-year surge in anti-abortion measures in more than half of all states has altered the landscape for abortion access, shutting some clinics, threatening others and making it far more difficult in many regions to obtain the procedure; advocates for both sides are preparing for new political campaigns and court battles that could redefine the constitutional limits for curbing the right to abortion set by the 1973 Roe v Wade decision.
lead_paragraph: A surge in anti-abortion measures in more than half the states has made it far more difficult in many regions to obtain the procedure.

headline.main: Access to Abortion Falling as States Pass Restrictions
headline.print_headline: Access to Abortion Falling As States Pass Restrictions
